thread.title: Victims in Madoff Ponzi scheme to 'be made completely whole'
thread.title_full: Victims in Madoff Ponzi scheme to 'be made completely whole' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Victims in Madoff Ponzi scheme to 'be made completely whole'
text:
Mario Tama/Getty Images Investors duped in the Bernie Madoff (pictured) Ponzi scheme will be getting their cash back, according to officials. A batch of Bernie Madoff victims who invested up to $1.1 million with the Ponzi king will soon recover all of their cash, officials said Tuesday
Anyone who invested up to $1,161,000 with the 77-year-old swindler will “be made completely whole” after the latest round of distribution payments, the head of the group responsible for returning money to hoodwinked investors told ABC News.
Stephen Harbeck, the CEO of Securities Investors Protection Corporation, said those people who trusted Madoff with more than $1.1 million are expected to recoup 61% of their investment .
“Coming out of a Ponzi scheme with 61% of what you started out with is a major victory,” Harbeck said.
ABC News Stephen Harbeck, President and CEO of the Securities Investors Protection Corporation, said that investors who bought into Bernard Madoff's Ponzi scheme are likely to get 61% of their investment back. The latest round of distribution payments — coming seven years after the collapse of the largest Ponzi scheme in U.S. history — were detailed in a new motion filed in federal bankruptcy court Tuesday.
Officials have managed to recover $11 billion of the $17 billion that they believe was lost when Madoff’s epic scam was exposed in 2008.
Sentenced to 150 years in prison in 2009, Madoff is serving his time at FCI Butner, a medium-security correctional facility in North Carolina.
